description: Originally derived from the Latin habitābilis (“habitable”), from habitō (“dwell, live”).

adjectives.description: habitable (comparative more habitable, superlative most habitable)

entries.meaning: Safe and comfortable, where humans, or other animals, can live; fit for habitation.
examples: After we found the freshwater spring we were more confident that the place was habitable.
Humankind has never found any other habitable planets apart from Earth.
